column7: @mrpatil007 we can discuss the Android app further in private messages or in in our Contributors room: https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors

-----

-----

-----
## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

@QuincyLarson  ok thanks. that's what i want..... :smile:
@mrpatil007 sure - we have all our assets in .svg and .png format here: https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/assets
@QuincyLarson  can you give me icon for our app
OK - thanks! I will look forward to seeing it :)
Now i am finalizing the app design it will deploy on sep 11
i am just talk about possibilities of what we can do in future
@QuincyLarson Yes i am talking about FCC Not gitter
@mrpatil007 banning users can be accomplished through Gitter by typing commands. I recommend just focusing on the FCC-related functionality for now and not worrying about Gitter functionality :)
Like we can create app for admins also to control the user, like banning users or to analysis the user interest and live user traffic and lot's.
we can do lot's of thinks By using this API
@QuincyLarson  oh great............. :smile:
Awesome! That is great news! We will work on the API ASAP. In the meantime, here is what the data for the users looks like: https://gist.github.com/QuincyLarson/168b200fe06d9822250603a4ea65c0d7
and one great news.i show this app design to my iOS Developer friend and he agree to design this app for iOS also :smile:
@QuincyLarson yup sure first  i need to complete the design then for functionality i need API
@mrpatil007 Let me know if I can be of any help.
OK - thanks!
@QuincyLarson yes sure. i am trying to complete this as soon as possible
Once it's ready, we can show @berkeleytrue and see what you need from public APIs to be able to continue
@mrpatil007 awesome! Thank you for the update.
@QuincyLarson  at sep 11 the androidApp is ready to go
@QuincyLarson  i  give white shades on green text check this out
[![new.png](https://files.gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/AndroidApp/rNnN/thumb/new.png)](https://files.gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/AndroidApp/rNnN/new.png)
ya sure
Awesome. I have an Android phone (one+ 3) and I am really excited to try this out :)
ok i change it to white shades
I recommend everything be white on Free Code Camp green (#006400). I noticed the project view sample you sent me had a cool looking but hard to read purple theme
I am eager to look at it.
Awesome! That sounds great!
@QuincyLarson yes works fine i tested in my device.
Yes - this looks really cool. Would the chat work very well on Android?
@/all
@QuincyLarson  did you see it ?
if you want some changes or suggestion plz tell
@QuincyLarson  checkout all the screen design give me green signal to start the code  :smile:

@QuincyLarson ok thanks
Yes - #006400 on white is ideal :)
@QuincyLarson let me know what changes You want in color scheme of our app is it good or i need to change
@QuincyLarson ya i am working on these section right now
Campers can see their points, streaks, and projects they've completed. This way they can stay motivated :)
Excellent. This is off to a good start. I recommend you focus initially just on profiles (which I see you've already started with).
@QuincyLarson Now creating mock-up for map module

@QuincyLarson Hi i created some design for our android Application lets check this out and give feedback the image is on our repo https://github.com/mrpatil007/Free-code-camp-Android/tree/master/mock-up
@QuincyLarson Yes Sure, I just Started to design a mock-up for android application
OK - let me know if I can be of any help with this. Assume we can do anything you need, and we can work out the details of how we can do it later :)
@QuincyLarson yes i think first we need to complete the structure and design of the app
Can you continue to build a prototype without it?
@mrpatil007 great! We are working on the open API and may have it ready in October or so.
@QuincyLarson https://github.com/mrpatil007/Free-code-camp-Android  started to code
@QuincyLarson ok is it in any api of  Free Code Camp to fetch the needed data

@mrpatil007 we are in the middle of the major overhaul and I can't devote many resources to it at this point. I don't think our GitHub issue tracker is the right place for this. I recommend you create a repo with your initial code and then we can use that repo initially, and potentially transfer the repo to the Free Code Camp GitHub organization later.
@mrpatil007 excellent.
@QuincyLarson :worried:
@QuincyLarson can we raise a issue for that
@QuincyLarson we can do lots of things with android application
@QuincyLarson ok sure give me a couple of days i will develop a demo for u with the basic implementation of our ideas
@QuincyLarson it will be nice if create an app for FCC That Notify User for new forum post and view there stats
But if you want to create a simple demo of the functionality you think would work best, I'd be interested in taking a look! :)
We are in the middle of a major overhaul of FCC and its curriculum
@mrpatil007 awesome! I would be thrilled to hear your ideas.
@QuincyLarson Yup I am Android ( Material design )+ php Developer
Yes - I agree - a simple client would be great. Something campers can use to check their stats and their friend's stats, and maybe browse the map.
@rajeefmk sorry I didn't respond to your message (from a year ago :worried: )
@mrpatil007 are you an Android developer?
Great Idea  @QuincyLarson  @rajeefmk

Hi Guys. What I have in mind (to begin with) is a simple client in which users can login, see their progress, along with the map. If more people like it / find it useful, we could keep adding features ( Like a reminder with progress in the form of push notification as per user preference). 

What do you think ?
I created this room to discuss a possible Android client that @rajeefmk has proposed building for Free Code Camp.
